title: EIP - 1417 Poll Standard

body: If this is intended to be a universal standard, are their any companies building anything with these guidelines?
What is the reason to record a failed vote? Does it add any value?
@psytronoxious Yes.. Electus Network is building on top of this. pollscan.io is a website which uses this standard to check poll results and audit voter stats.

@someshyv Recording failed votes helps in auditing purposes and to keep a check to prevent owner malpractices where he removes eliminates certain voters from participating. we can use all failed votes as well to calculate off-chain, the result that would be had the owner not removed the participants maliciously.

Would it be useful to add a "vote temporarily suspended" flag, modifiable only by the owner of the contract. When true, no vote would be accepted. Voting would start or restart when the flag is set to false. This could be used as a signal to start accepting votes (e.g. a vote that happens after the last speaker ends his presentation), or as an emergency vote-suspension flag (e.g. any kind of voting issues). The flag could be activated multiple times and would be logged.

@GillesdeB That's a very good idea. Sure. A custom implementation could surely have that. But since, it is a feature intended only for the owners of the contract, it needn't be specified in the interface.
But, if enough people agree, it can be brought into the interface.
